business.headline: Reliance-Disney merger approved, parties agree not to bundle cricket ad slotsA detailed order approving the mega media assets merger of Reliance Industries and Walt Disney was published by the Competition Commission of India on Tuesday.

IMF holds India's GDP growth steady at 7% for FY25, 6.5% for FY26The International Monetary Fund (IMF) suggests that the initial demand surge following the pandemic is now easing, with the economy returning to a more normal state.

Worried AI might replace you? This survey will change your mindThe latest findings from Adecco Group's 'Global Workforce of the Future 2024' report offer a contrasting view of how artificial intelligence (AI) is influencing workplaces, compared to common perceptions.

Not just smog but onions too will leave you teary-eyed this DiwaliOnions are currently selling for Rs 60-80 per kg in retail markets, and the impact of weather disruptions is likely to keep prices elevated.

Zomato Q2 results: Profit soars 389% to Rs 176 crore, revenue jumps 68%Zomato Q2 results: The strong bottom-line performance can be attributed to rising food delivery margins and the quick commerce segment, which is nearing break-even.
Sensex crashes over 900 points, Nifty drops below crucial support levelThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 930.55 points to end at 80,220.72, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 309 points to close at 24,472.10.

Stock market meltdown: Why Sensex tanked over 900 points todayStock market today: At the closing bell, Sensex plunged 930.55 points to 80,220.72, while the Nifty fell 309 points to 24,472.10. The sharp decline wiped out over Rs 9 lakh crore in the BSE's market capitalisation, leaving many investors reeling.

Has Adar Poonawalla hit bull's eye with Dharma Productions acquisition?Dharma Productions, established in 1976 by producer Yash Johar and now overseen by his son Karan Johar, has played a significant role in shaping Hindi cinema.

Opposition's charge against Sebi chief false: Government sourcesSerious allegations of conflict of interest and financial misconduct were levelled against the Sebi chief by US short-seller Hindenburg Research and the Congress party.

Ambuja Cement acquires Orient Cements for Rs 8,100 crore. Details here Ambuja Cement aims to increase its cement production capacity to 100 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) by FY25, with the acquisition adding about 30 MTPA to its total.

Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders share price down nearly 9%. Know whyMazagon Dock Shipbuilders stock price: Shares of the company were trading 8.52% lower at Rs 4,268.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 12:39 pm.

Paytm share price plunges 7% despite Q2 profit growth. Here's whyPaytm share price today: The digital payment firm's share price plunged sharply despite the company posting a net profit in the second quarter of the ongoing financial year.

Paytm showcases strong growth in revenue, delivers profit of Rs 930 crore in Q2Paytm Q2 results: The quarter also witnessed a steady rise in revenue and contribution profit, reflecting the success of Paytm's strategy of scaling payments and expanding its financial services offerings.

Hyundai Motor makes weak D-Street debut. Hold for long-term gains or sell now?Hyundai Motor India stock market listing: A long-term ride to profits or time for investors to hit the brakes after its lacklustre debut?
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher led by gains in bank and IT stocks The S&P BSE Sensex gained 153.24 points to 81,304.51, while the NIfty50 added 36.80 points to 24,817.90

Hyundai Motor India, India's biggest IPO, disappoints on stock market debut Hyundai share market listing: The IPO, which closed with an overall subscription of 2.37 times, saw tepid interest from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Hyundai IPO set for muted stock market debut on BSE, NSEHyundai India Share Price Listing: The IPO, which opened on October 15, faced a slow start, particularly from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Bitcoin prices surge past $69,000: What's driving the rally? Bitcoin touched $69,408.1 (roughly Rs 58,35,227) on international exchanges on Monday, marking a recovery after the cryptocurrency was in a price slump for the last three months.
Bajaj Housing Finance Q2 results: Net profit jumps 21% YoY to Rs 546 croreThe revenue from operations also saw a significant rise, with the company reporting Rs 2,410 crore for Q2FY25.

Health Insurer Niva Bupa gets Sebi nod for Rs 3,000 crore IPO. Details hereThe IPO, which the company filed for back in June, will consist of a mix of Rs 800 crore in fresh shares and an offer for sale (OFS) that includes Rs 320 crore from Bupa Singapore Holdings and Rs 1,880 crore from Fettle Tone LLP.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Made scapegoat: Lawyers of ex-RAW official charged by US in Pannun murder plotSpeaking to India Today TV, Vikash Yadav's lawyers RK Handoo and Aditya Choudhary said that there was no truth to the allegations levelled against him and that he was being made a scapegoat in international politics.

Maha Vikas Aghadi finalises seat-sharing for Maharashtra polls: SourcesThe Congress is likely to contest 105 to 110 seats, Uddhav Thackeray's Sena will be allotted 90 to 95 seats, and Sharad Pawar's NCP is expected to field candidates in 75 to 80 constituencies, sources said.

3 dead, many trapped as under-construction building collapses in BengaluruAn under-construction building collapsed in Bengaluru, and three bodies were recovered. Two people were rescued but 12 are still feared trapped even as rescue operations are underway.

Our ties so close, no translation needed: Putin's remark makes PM Modi chucklePrime Minister Narendra Modi and Russian President Vladimir Putin held a bilateral meeting on the sidelines of the Brics Summit in Kazan. This is PM Modi's second visit to Russia in three months.

What are chak-chak, korovai offered to PM Modi in Russia? In Russia for the Brics summit, PM Narendra Modi was offered Russian delights -- chak-chak laddus and a korovai cake. What are chak-chak and korovai, and why were they used to welcoming Modi and other world leaders?

Mahayuti seat-sharing pact finalised, BJP to get majority share: SourcesAs per the seat-sharing pact, the BJP is likely to get 152-155 seats, Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena will get 78-80 seats, and Ajit Pawar-led NCP will get 52-54 seats, sources said.

That's her personal opinion: Vinesh Phogat on Sakshi Malik's 'greed' claimsIn her book, Sakshi Malik claimed that Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia's decision to accept exemption from the Asian Games trials last year hit the image of their protest as it made their movement seem "selfish".
Woman dragged for several meters during chain-snatching bid in MaduraiCCTV footage revealed the woman, who fell to the ground during a chain-snatching attempt, being dragged for several meters.

Why Elon Musk is hijacking Trump's campaignElon Musk, the Tesla and SpaceX boss, has put in everything to back Republican candidate Donald Trump in the 2024 US presidential election. However, it isn't just about campaigning for Trump. Musk, the "dark MAGA", might be working towards a technocratic state, where corporates needn't be at the mercy of regulators.

Elevating Your Career with IIM Kozhikode's Advanced Operations Analytics and Supply Chain Management ProgrammeElevate your career with IIM Kozhikode's comprehensive programme, designed to equip professionals with the latest tools and strategies in operations management and data analytics. Gain hands-on experience through live sessions, capstone projects, and industry-relevant assignments, while accessing the prestigious IIMK Executive Alumni network.

Chaos at Waqf panel meet, Trinamool MP smashes bottle in anger, injures handSources said the Trinamool MP picked up a glass water bottle and hit it on the table and hurt himself by accident during the meeting on the Waqf bill.

India ready to provide all cooperation to resolve Ukraine conflict: PM to PutinIn his bilateral meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India is willing to provide all cooperation for a peaceful resolution to the Ukraine conflict.
Here's a guide to luxury gifting for this festive seasonLuxury Indian gifting is about more than the gift itself, it should be an experience

From the India Today archives (2016) | V.S. Achuthanandan: Return of the angry old manAs India's oldest communist leader turns 101 years old, a flashback from the redoubtable warhorse of Kerala politics

Video of 3 men provoking leopardess in Madhya Pradesh has an expected endA video of a leopardess attacking a group of men at a picnic spot in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district went viral on social media.

'Deeply appalled': India's sporting heroes shocked by Commonwealth Games trimming Commonwealth Games 2026: Quite a few Indian sports stars have voiced against the timing of Commonwealth Games 2026. As many as nine sports have been dropped from the roster due to rising costs. Some of India's biggest medal-yielding sports have also been dropped.

Why do planes dump fuel during emergency landings, and where does it go?While fuel dumping may seem counterintuitive, especially given current fuel prices, it remains a crucial safety measure in aviation.

79 flights receive fresh threats in 24 hours, over 160 hoax calls in a weekSeveral airlines have reported a series of fresh threats affecting 79 of its flights, mainly on international routes, this morning. The incidents, involving multiple hoax calls, have pushed the total number of such threats received by the airline this week to around 169.

Top Mumbai club removes Jemimah Rodrigues over father's 'religious activities'Khar Gymkhana in Mumbai has revoked Jemimah Rodrigues' membership after her father used the club for religious activities. The decision followed concerns over breach of club rules.

Has Adar Poonawalla hit bull's eye with Dharma Productions acquisition?Dharma Productions, established in 1976 by producer Yash Johar and now overseen by his son Karan Johar, has played a significant role in shaping Hindi cinema.

Can Japan's friendship marriages be a hit in India too?In Japan, a growing number of people are embracing 'friendship marriages' - partnerships where individuals choose to live together and marry platonic friends rather than romantic partners. Could this concept gain popularity in India as well?

Man chasing dog at Hyderabad hotel falls off third floor window, diesCCTV footage showed the man chasing the dog away before he accidentally fell through the open window on the third floor of a hotel.
Why Odisha government is on a renaming spreeAfter 24 years of Naveen Patnaik, the BJP government in Odisha is setting out to leave its own mark on the state
China confirms agreement with India to end border standoff in LadakhBeijing said that it has reached a resolution with New Delhi on resolving the border conflict and will work to implement solutions.
Nithya Menen on her National Award and choicesActress Nithya Menen spoke about her National Award for Thiruchitrabalam and more.

Former Iron Maiden lead singer Paul Di'Anno dies at 66Heavy metal band Iron Maiden's former lead singer, Paul Di'Anno, has died at 66, leaving a lasting legacy. Known for his rebellious persona and powerful vocals, Di'Anno was instrumental in shaping the band's early success.

Video: Bobby Deol clicks selfies with fans as he promotes Kanguva in MumbaiBollywood actor Bobby Deol is busy promoting his upcoming pan-India film Kanguva. The actor was photographed after a promotional event, where he graciously obliged his fans with selfies.

Actor Vikrant Massey in talks to play Sri Sri Ravi Shankar in new filmActor Vikrant Massey is in talks to play the role of Shri Shri Ravi Shankar in the upcoming untitled project. The movie will be bankrolled by Mahaveer Jain and Siddharth Anand.

sports.headline: Sultan of Johor Cup: India continue unbeaten run with 4-2 win over MalaysiaThe Indian Junior Men's Hockey Team showcased their dominance with a 4-2 victory over Malaysia, securing their third consecutive win in the Sultan of Johor Cup. This victory places them at the top of the points table, reinforcing their status as strong title contenders.

One thing I am worried about Sarfaraz Khan: Brad Hogg suspects weakness vs bounceBard Hogg suspected Sarfaraz Khan's weakness against bounce with his hands keeping low while facing the pacers. His remarks came ahead of the impending Border Gavaskar Trophy series, with chances of Sarfaraz facing the likes of Pat Cummins, Josh Hazledwood and Mitchell Starc.

God knows! Harry Brook's cheeky assessment of pitch for Rawalpindi Test Pakistan vs England: Star batter Harry Brook said he expects the Rawalpindi pitch to be vastly different from how it was in 2022. England are heading into the series finale after losing the second Test on a dry pitch in Multan.

Dance group Quick Style reviews Virat Kohli's moves after viral collaborationQuick Style members reviewed Virat Kohli's dance moves after their collaboration from last year, which sent the fans into frenzy. The members said that Kohli was really down to earth and danced more than they expected.

No point sugarcoating, Sarfaraz and KL Rahul fighting for a spot: DoeschateSpeaking to the press in the lead-up to the second Test in Pune, India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate said India have a healthy headache when it comes to their batting unit. He said Sarfaraz Khan and KL Rahul are fighting for the No. 6 spot in the XI. Shubman Gill, who missed the first Test due to a stiff neck, will return to the second Test in Pune, starting October 24.

Exclusive: SRH set to retain 3 overseas stars along with Nitish and Abhishek SunRisers Hyderabad are set to retain 5 players ahead of the Indian Premier League auction for the 2025 season. Sources have confirmed to IndiaToday.in that Abhishek Sharma and Nitish Reddy will be the only 2 Indian players retained by the team.

The spin-friendly tracks helped Pakistan dominate and win the Test by 152 runs.

Mohammed Shami advises Siraj to not get 'frustrated' over below par outingsIndia fast bowler Mohammed Shami has advised struggling Mohammed Siraj to focus on the basics after below par showings in recent home Test matches.

Instead, Cook called Root to congratulate him and discuss the achievement.

Why Rishabh Pant's Bengaluru heroics didn't scare New Zealand, reveals MitchellNew Zealand all-rounder Daryl Mitchell revealed that Rishabh Pant's heroics in the second Test didn't scare their team as they were focussed on taking wickets.

Watch: Jason Gillespie picks littered bottles by Pakistan players after trainingA video has been going viral on social media where Pakistan team's Test coach was spotted picking up discarded bottles littered by the players after their training session in Rawalpindi.

New Zealand not worried if Pune Test pitch is spin-friendly: Daryl MitchellIndia vs New Zealand: All-rounder Daryl Mitchell said New Zealand will be prepared for spin-friendly conditions in the second Test, starting October 24 in Pune. Speculation is rife that the pitch in Pune will assist spin bowlers. India lost the first Test in pacer-friendly conditions in Bengaluru.

IND vs NZ: What happened the last time India played a Test match in PuneIndia will host New Zealand at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium in Pune for the 2nd Test. Let us get to know India's history in the format at this venue.

India captain, coach respond to hockey's exclusion from Commonwealth Games 2026India's hockey captain Harmanpreet Singh and coach Craig Fulton expressed disappointment over hockey's exclusion from the 2026 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow. The event will feature only 10 sports, excluding several where India excels, as part of budget constraints.

BAN vs SA: Mahmudul, Mushfiqur hold fort for Bangladesh on Day 2 after early blowsBangladesh finished Day 2 of the first Test against South Africa on 101/3 trailing by 101 runs. . Mahmudul Hasan Joy (38*) and Mushfiqur Rahim (31*) took their team to stumps after early strikes from Kagiso Rabada.

Commonwealth Games trimming conspiracy to sideline India: Badminton body secretary Commonwealth Games 2026: The Glasgow edition of the quadrennial spectacle has been trimmed to 10 spots. Some of India's productive sports, including badminton, shooting and wrestling, have been dropped from the roster.

Watch: Hasan Mahmud's direct throw misses the stumps, hits South African batterA wild throw from Hasan Mahmud struck Dane Piedt instead of the stumps, turning a simple run-out into a hilarious mishap. The chaotic moment on Day 2 left players and fans in splits as South Africa dominated proceedings.

Kyle Verreynne scores first hundred by South Africa wicketkeeper in BangladeshSouth Africa's Kyle Verreynne became the first wicketkeeper batter from his nation to score a Test century in Bangladesh during Day 2 of the first Test against the hosts.

I'm back: Emotional Neymar thrilled after 12-month injury return for Al-HilalAn emotional Neymar proclaimed that he is well and truly back after making his return for Al-Hilal on October 21, Monday. Neymar came on a substitute for Al-Hilal in their match against Al-Ain.

Mohammed Siraj is going through a wicked drought: Assistant coach Ten DoeschateIND vs NZ: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate is not worried about Mohammed Siraj's dry run in home Tests. Siraj was not able to pick a single wicket with the new ball despite overseas conditions in the Bengaluru Test match.

David Warner ready to reverse retirement if needed for Border-Gavaskar TrophyBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: David Warner said he is ready to come back from retirement and open the batting for Australia in the upcoming five-match Test series against India.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
